pr_title: [#9382] Enable downloading of feedback session results as CSV

timeline.message: Enable downloading of feedback session results as csv
Enable downloading session results from instructor home page

timeline.bodyText: I honestly feel SectionDetail.containsSectionDetail should return true/false instead. You are not even using the value it returns here.
timeline.author: rrtheonlyone

replies.bodyText: Yes I think you are right. I'm not sure why SectionDetail.containsSectionDetail returns SectionDetail object since the value does not seem to be used anywhere else either. I will change the return type of that function.
replies.author: niqiukun

timeline.bodyText: what is this supposed to be? Is it a placeholder of some kind for later?
timeline.author: rrtheonlyone

replies.bodyText: This is used in the original InstructorFeedbackResultsDownloadAction also to simulate the test case where the data is to large to be downloaded at one time. You may refer to #8882.
replies.author: niqiukun

timeline.bodyText: I feel "All".equals(section) is a little hacky and hardcoded - any way to make it cleaner?
timeline.author: rrtheonlyone

replies.bodyText: This is ported from the InstructorFeedbackResultsDownloadAction class. I agree that this is a hardcoded value. Maybe we can remove it since section == null already implies all sections will be downloaded.
replies.author: niqiukun

timeline.author: rrtheonlyone

replies.bodyText: Ok I have added the grouping for the params.
replies.author: niqiukun

timeline.author: rrtheonlyone

replies.bodyText: This is because I was writing code GetSessionResultsActionTest which is currently missing. Although I agree that this is not exactly related to CSV downloads, but still I think the test is nevertheless necessary. And since I'm writing GetSessionResultsAsCsvActionTest, I thought it would be ok just to add GetSessionResultsActionTest at the same time.
replies.author: niqiukun

timeline.bodyText:
For this, what about a test for:

typical case with section name "All"? (the if case above)
typical case with stats shown?
timeline.author: rrtheonlyone

replies.bodyText: I have added the test cases for stats hidden and shown. Thanks for spotting that! Regarding the section name "All" I think it would better to remove the hardcoded value.
replies.author: niqiukun

replies.bodyText: I discovered a problem when I tried to add test for case with stats shown. I notice that all questions in the typical data bundle are text-based questions which have no statistics to show. I am considering adding a new session to the typical data bundle, but that will break other tests that also rely on the typical data bundle. May I have some suggestions on how to resolve this issue? @rrtheonlyone
replies.author: niqiukun

replies.bodyText: @xpdavid is there any way to update the typical bundle? Or is it better to just create something just for this test here?
replies.author: rrtheonlyone

replies.bodyText: If you don't want to create a separate json file (which in most of case is not necessary), you can manipulate/add/delete the database in @BeforeMethod
replies.author: xpdavid
niqiukun

replies.bodyText: Interesting...
replies.author: rrtheonlyone

timeline.bodyText: Is this test related to your PR?
timeline.author: rrtheonlyone

replies.bodyText: Not exactly. But since I'm writing GetSessionResultsAsCsvActionTest, I thought it would be ok just to add GetSessionResultsActionTest at the same time because the test for GetSessionResultsAction is currently missing. There shouldn't be any breaking changes to existing code.
replies.author: niqiukun

timeline.message: Change return type of containsSectionDetail and group params
Add test cases for statistics hidden and shown
Move http request to feedback sessions service
Use custom data bundle for GetSessionResultsAsCsvActionTest
Use custom data bundle for GetSessionResultsAsCsvActionTest
Remove unnecessary data from custom data bundle
Further reduce custom bundle size by using typical bundle for other tests
Add missing type param for csv download

timeline.bodyText:
I am still not entirely convinced by this. I feel that the excess data error should come from the logic layer (and not passed in from the client).
Why is it part of our API params?
timeline.author: rrtheonlyone

replies.bodyText: The excess data error indeed comes from the logic layer in practice. However for testing it is not practical to generate large amount of data just to trigger the error. Hence, this param is kept there so that the error is triggered manually and exception handling can be tested. But you are right in the way that it does not actually test whether the exception will be thrown at the right time, so it is only tested partially. I'm not really sure if there are better ways to do this.
replies.author: niqiukun

replies.bodyText:
For just testing this on the API layer, you can mock the logic layer call to throw the relevant exception. For E2E testing, we probably HAVE to generate big data! At least that's what I think :)
It seems a little odd that we are adding a functionality just for our own internal testing. However, we def have to discuss on this with the rest and see.
replies.author: rrtheonlyone

replies.bodyText:
For just testing this on the API layer, you can mock the logic layer call to throw the relevant exception.

Sorry but I don't quite get this part. Could you explain a bit more? Thanks :)
replies.author: niqiukun

replies.bodyText: Adding this line in production code just for testing?
replies.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText: Who will throw ExceedingRangeException?
replies.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText:
Adding this line in production code just for testing?

This is carried forward from #8882. This is how the previous developer describes its use:
In the `InstructorFeedbackResultsDownloadActionTest` we add a test
where we put in an extra parameter `largeData=true` and then in the Action class
we put an if condition to see if this parameter is not null and true and if it is then we
throw the required exception for the `code` of exception part to be called and assert
in the test if thats what we expect to happen

I would like to have some suggestions on improving this if this is not a good programming practice.

Who will throw ExceedingRangeException?

logic.getFeedbackSessionResultSummaryAsCsv(...) and logic.getFeedbackSessionResultSummaryInSectionAsCsv(...) throw this exception.
replies.author: niqiukun

replies.bodyText: Then we should meet the condition to let getFeedbackSessionResultSummaryAsCsv or getFeedbackSessionResultSummaryInSectionAsCsv throw the exception? Or even remove the test because it actually test nothing.
replies.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText:
Then we should meet the condition to let getFeedbackSessionResultSummaryAsCsv or getFeedbackSessionResultSummaryInSectionAsCsv throw the exception? Or even remove the test because it actually test nothing.

The test file is not large enough to trigger the condition that throws this exception. I think it may be better to remove this test then.
replies.author: niqiukun

replies.bodyText:
Hi @niqiukun , sorry missed your earlier question, I was thinking more of something like this: https://se-education.org/se-book/testing/#stubs
I was wondering if you can just mock the logic layer to throw the relevant exception for testing the API layer. For E2E testing, we can just generate a large csv into the database.
replies.author: rrtheonlyone

replies.bodyText: Introducing mock for logic layer requires a huge effort without help from mocking framework. We might want to do it separately.  I think we can just remove the test till now.
replies.author: xpdavid

timeline.bodyText: Where are the tests for student's accessing their results?
timeline.author: rrtheonlyone

replies.bodyText: I have added them in the latest commit. Thanks for spotting that!
replies.author: niqiukun

timeline.bodyText: I see what you are doing here and it works! Although its a little different from how our other tests work.. maybe @xpdavid can help improve this.
timeline.author: rrtheonlyone

replies.bodyText: I think it is OK to create a new data file for this test case as downloading as CSV is a big feature. One thing to note here is that please override the corresponding method to avoid typicalDataBundle from loading.
replies.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText: The way I did this was only using the custom data bundle for session with statistics. By doing that I don't have to duplicate the typical data bundle for those test cases that do not require the custom data bundle. And that's why typicalDataBundle is still being loaded here.
replies.author: niqiukun

replies.bodyText: So your json file is incremental based on typicalDataBundle?
replies.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText: It only contains one session but with a MCQ question instead of a text question, so that there will be statistics that can be downloaded. I did not include those sessions that were originally in the typicalDataBundle. But this json file is only used for two test cases: Typical case: results with statistics hidden and Typical case: results with statistics shown. All other test cases use typicalDataBundle instead.
replies.author: niqiukun

timeline.message: Add student test cases for GetSessionResultsActionTest

timeline.bodyText:
Is this method added just for the sake of testing?
If yes, please convert it to helper method in the test file or you are responsible to write a comprehensive test for it (which I think it is not necessary).
timeline.author: xpdavid

replies.bodyText: I see your point. I would like to convert it to a helper method, but here QuestionOutput is an inner class that has private access. Should I change the accessibility of the class or is there any workaround?
replies.author: niqiukun

replies.bodyText: You can make the change.
replies.author: xpdavid

timeline.message: Move helper methods to test and change accessibility of inner classes
Move helper methods to test and change accessibility of inner classes
